title: The Moxie and Its Amazing Technicolor Account Number
body:
As of today, Moxie Cinema is a registered theater with Technicolor, the world's number one processor and distributor of motion picture film. If you want to be a theater, you have to have an account with Technicolor or else you can't:

1. Get films from distributors
2. Receive film in the mail
3. Show film... since you have none

As Paul our booking agent put it, "the Industry has now welcomed you with open arms. Now you just need to build a movie theater." True that, Paul. True that.
author: Dan

comments.author: Dave
comments.body: so it's like netflix for the big boys

comments.author: Dave Adams
comments.body: That's excellent, Dan!  Every hurdle cleared is a cause for celebration.  Does it require some kind of certification or is it more of a means to hunt you down if you lose the print or splice in porn or something?

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Well, it requires a certification in patience, I'll tell you that much. Distributors won't talk to you unless you have a Technicolor account, and Technicolor won't talk to you until you book a movie through a distributor. Luckily, Paul knew a nice woman from Wellspring Films (they're the distributors for "Tarnation") who booked us a film and pushed our paperwork through. It was a big hurdle to jump, but we DID IT!

comments.author: justin
comments.body: Will they send you an Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat?

comments.author: Oz
comments.body: Baby steps, eh?  Congrats on this one!

comments.author: Newell
comments.body: How about an amazing technicolor cheese wedge? I had one built on top of my interocitor.
